pull.title: Do not expose and consider -logthreadnames when it does not work
pull.body:
There are conditions when the `HAVE_THREAD_LOCAL` macro is undefined what causes the `-logthreadnames` option does not work -- instead of thread names empty strings `[]` only are printed in the `debug.log` file.

This PR does not exposes the `-logthreadnames` option in such cases.

Refs:
- #16059
- #18652

issue.title: 0.20.0rc1: Broken -logthreadnames on gitian builds
issue.body:
On `0.20.0rc1`, or on just a gitian build against master (4702cadca94520a36bfe979c85750563c30f7c85), the `debug.log` contains empty thread names:

```
2020-04-15T12:37:41Z [] Bitcoin Core version v0.20.0rc1 (release build)
...
2020-04-15T12:37:41Z [] Config file arg: logthreadnames="1"
...
```

Tested on Linux Mint 19.3 (x86) and ODROID-HC1 (ARM, bionic).

events.body:
ACK 2ea5807fd36391e8f3b03c883066666132cfcb69

I'd prefer the option to just work in gitian builds, but this is a good and simple workaround.
Can you explain how the patch is supposed to work? Making an argument hidden in the help does not at all influence how it is parsed. The `[]` are still printed

issue.title: [0.20] rc2 Backports
issue.body:
Currently backports the following to the 0.20 branch:

* #18598 - gitian: Add missing automake package to gitian-win-signer.yml
* #18702 - build: fix ASLR for bitcoin-cli on Windows
* #18676 - build: Check libevent minimum version in configure script 
* #18665 - Do not expose and consider -logthreadnames when it does not work 
* #18553 - Avoid non-trivial global constants in SHA-NI code 
* #18589 - Fix naming of macOS SDK and clarify version
